Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
YouTube-8M is a large-scale video understanding dataset project initiated by Google Research, aimed at providing high-quality annotated video data to the machine learning community to advance research in video content analysis, multimodal learning, and related fields. Launched in 2016, the project extracted visual and audio features from millions of publicly available YouTube videos, creating one of the largest open video datasets at the time.

As the supporting organization, Google Research has long been committed to developing open datasets and tools to promote equitable access to and innovation in AI technologies. The release of YouTube-8M filled a gap in the availability of large-scale annotated video data, establishing it as a key benchmark resource for computer vision and video classification tasks.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
The YouTube-8M dataset contains the following core components, making it well-suited for storage on the Filecoin decentralized storage network:

Video IDs and Metadata: Unique identifiers, titles, durations, and public tags (covering thousands of object, scene, and action categories) for 8 million YouTube videos.

Precomputed Features:

Visual Features: Inception-v3 network features extracted from video frames (approximately 1,000 frames per video, totaling billions of frames).

Audio Features: Acoustic features including Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (MFCC).

Annotation Data: Video-level labels (multi-label classification) generated by YouTube's automated annotation system, with partial human verification.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: As a Filecoin data preparer, I would: 1) First clean and organize the raw data using Python and Spark tools to extract video features and metadata; 2) Package the processed data into CAR format files using IPFS tools and generate content identifiers (CIDs); 3) Finally store the data chunks on the Filecoin network via the Lotus client while recording storage deals and retrieval information. The entire process ensures data integrity and verifiability.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Greater China, Asia other than Greater China, North America, South America, Europe, Australia (continent), Antarctica
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: HTTP or FTP server, Shipping hard drives
